result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Cheree
Cases 14CF115, 14CF288, 14CF632, 14CF693 called: 2:11pm
State appears by ADA L.Leonhard.  Def appears in person and with Atty Dana Norgard.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  Waiver of Prelim in 14CF632 filed. VRCW in all files

Court questions deft as to waiver of prelim in 14CF632.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information filed.  Reading Waived. Not Guilty pleas entered at this time

State moves to:
14CF693 - D&RI entire file
14CF115 - Cts. 2, 4 and 5>>D&RI
14CF632 - Cts. 2, 3, 4, and 5>>D&RI
14CF288 - Ct. 1>>D&RI
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA: 
14CF115 - Ct. 1 (Poss Para to Manufacture Meth/PTAC/2nd+ Offense)>>NO CONTEST
14CF115 - Ct. 3 (Poss of Cocaine 2nd+ Offense/PTAC)>>NO CONTEST
14CF288 - Ct. 2 (Poss Para)>>NO CONTEST
14CF632 - Ct. 1 (Poss Narcotic Drugs/2nd+ Offense)>>NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a  factual basis & def guilty.
Atty Norgard gives statement on behalf of defendant - requests DNA sample and surcharge only be 

COURT ORDERS: 
On Felony counts - Sentence W/held - 4 Years Probation on each count, concurrent to each other and to Misd counts
On Misd count - Sentence W/held - 1 year Probation, concurrent to each other and to Felony counts
CONDITIONS: in 14CF115 - Ct. 3 only--6 months MCJ I&S any portion of which to be used for rule violations; 80 hours c.s. total; Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; CC including one DNA surcharge on each of 3 cases, and one DNA sample; Maintain absolute sobriety and submit for testing as required by PO; GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof; AODA and any follow up as recommended; N/C with co-defendants as follows: Kayla Weiks, Gino Chiarello, Jennifer Burnett, Joseph Glenetski, Natasha Eldrige; Contact as allowed for by PO with Phillip McClure.

Credit if revoked, credit as follows: 14CF115-2 days; 14CF632-10 days; 17 days of time served in 14CF693 are credited to 14CF288

Clerk Deanna.

Atty Gramer states history.  Deft wishes to waive time limits.
COURT:  Time limits waived.

Adj:  9:34 am

No contact with P.M. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
